Serializers Documentation

This section documents all the Django REST Framework serializers in the News Application.

Serializers Module

Serializers for news application REST API.

class news.serializers.ArticleListSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Simplified serializer for article lists.

model

alias of Article

class news.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Article model with nested relationships.

This serializer handles article serialization with nested user, publisher, and category information. It supports both read and write operations with proper field handling for API endpoints.

Parameters:

  • author (UserSerializer) – Nested UserSerializer for article author information

  • publisher (PublisherSerializer) – Nested PublisherSerializer for publisher information

  • category (CategorySerializer) – Nested CategorySerializer for category information

  • author_id (int) – Write-only field for author ID assignment

  • publisher_id (int) – Write-only field for publisher ID assignment

  • category_id (int) – Write-only field for category ID assignment

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Meta options for ArticleSerializer.

fields = ['id', 'title', 'content', 'summary', 'author', 'publisher', 'category', 'status', 'is_approved', 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'published_at', 'author_id', 'publisher_id', 'category_id']
model

alias of Article

read_only_fields = ['id', 'is_approved', 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'published_at']
create(validated_data)[source]

Create article with proper author assignment.

This method creates a new article instance with the provided validated data, handling author, publisher, and category relationships properly.

Parameters:

validated_data (dict) – Dictionary of validated form data

Returns:

Created Article instance

Return type:

Article

Update article with proper field handling.

class news.serializers.UserSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for User model with role-based field access.

This serializer handles serialization of User objects for API responses. It includes user identification, role information, and account status while maintaining security by excluding sensitive fields.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – User’s unique identifier

  • username (str) – User’s unique username

  • email (str) – User’s email address

  • first_name (str) – User’s first name

  • last_name (str) – User’s last name

  • role (str) – User’s role (reader, editor, journalist)

  • date_joined (datetime) – Account creation timestamp

  • is_active (bool) – Account active status

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Meta options for UserSerializer.

fields = ['id', 'username', 'email', 'first_name', 'last_name', 'role', 'date_joined', 'is_active']
model

alias of User

read_only_fields = ['id', 'date_joined']

class news.serializers.ArticleSerializer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for Article model with nested relationships.

This serializer handles article serialization with nested user, publisher, and category information. It supports both read and write operations with proper field handling for API endpoints.

Parameters:

  • author (UserSerializer) – Nested UserSerializer for article author information

  • publisher (PublisherSerializer) – Nested PublisherSerializer for publisher information

  • category (CategorySerializer) – Nested CategorySerializer for category information

  • author_id (int) – Write-only field for author ID assignment

  • publisher_id (int) – Write-only field for publisher ID assignment

  • category_id (int) – Write-only field for category ID assignment
